title: Request for documents issued for undertakings signed on 26.07.17 with regard to Leeds High Court case for application of an injunction: SCC vs Alice Fairhall et al (Case D92LS739)

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
On 27 June 2017 a number of people were issued a pre-protocol letter, (Proposed Claim For An Injunction) Ref. GEG/079474. This was accompanied by a one page 'Undertaking To Sheffield City Council' sheet for signing before 11th July 2017. I have copies of both these documents.
On 26 July 2017, a number of defendants at Leeds High Court for the case (D92LS739) of the above mentioned injunction application (SCC vs Alice Fairhall et al) signed undertakings shortly before the first hearing began. I would like to know what documents they were issued. I presume they would have been given pre-protocol letters along with the undertaking sheet to sign. I request these as I want to see if they differ from those issued on 27 June 2017.
Yours faithfully,
Martin Pickles

Dear Martin Pickles,
Thank you for your request for information relating to documents issued
for undertakings signed on 26.07.17 with regard to Leeds High Court case
for application of an injunction: SCC vs Alice Fairhall et al (Case
D92LS739) which we received on 14/08/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 12/09/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: Martin Pickles <[FOI #1015126 email]>
Sent: Monday, August 14, 2023 1:36 PM
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Freedom of Information request - Request for documents issued for
undertakings signed on 26.07.17 with regard to Leeds High Court case for
application of an injunction: SCC vs Alice Fairhall et al (Case D92LS739)
Dear Sheffield City Council,
On 27 June 2017 a number of people were issued a pre-protocol letter,
(Proposed Claim For An Injunction) Ref. GEG/079474. This was accompanied
by a one page 'Undertaking To Sheffield City Council' sheet for signing
before 11th July 2017. I have copies of both these documents.
On 26 July 2017, a number of defendants at Leeds High Court for the case
(D92LS739) of the above mentioned injunction application (SCC vs Alice
Fairhall et al) signed undertakings shortly before the first hearing
began. I would like to know what documents they were issued. I presume
they would have been given pre-protocol letters along with the undertaking
sheet to sign. I request these as I want to see if they differ from those
issued on 27 June 2017.
Yours faithfully,
Martin Pickles
-------------------------------------------------------------------

requests to Sheffield City Council? If so, please contact us using this

Dear Martin Pickles
Thank you for your request for information relating to documents issued
for undertakings signed on 26.07.17 with regard to Leeds High Court case
for application of an injunction: SCC vs Alice Fairhall et al (Case
D92LS739) which we received on 14/08/2023.
We are making a partial response today by referring you to the Street Tree
Archive. The following files are relevant:
Case file 73204 - Rustlings Road (Removal of Trees and TRO [Traffic
Regulation Order] issues), 21 Aug 2015 - 1 Aug 2017 (X966/1).
Case file 84177 - Street Trees Consultation 2018, 25 Jul 2018 - 1 Jul 2019
(X966/2).
Case file 83325 - Street Trees Forestry Commission Criminal Investigation
2018 - Advice, 8 May 2018 - 12 Jun 2020 (X966/3).
Case file 80620 - Email regarding Amey carrying out work on TPO [Tree
Protection Order] trees - Advice, 12 Jul 2017 (X966/4).
Case file 77669 - Outstanding complaints, trees, Streets Ahead - Advice,
[26 Feb] - 5 Oct 2016 (X966/5).
Case file 75371 - Dillner v SCC - Judicial Review Advice, 5 Feb 2016 - [6
Jul 2017] (X966/6).
Case file 77825 - Street Trees Advice, 3 Sep 2015 - 8 Jul 2019 (X966/7).
Case file 79474 - Sheffield Street Trees Injunction 2017, 19 Feb 2016 - 11
Jun 2021 (X966/8).
Photographic and video surveillance evidence and Facebook screenshots
collected by Amey during protests against tree removals, etc, 2017 (X966/9
The files may be accessed at the link below in addition to which a search
of the archive catalogue ([1]CalmView: Home Page) for the word
‘injunction’ will bring up a number of references which you may wish to
view online.
We are extending the deadline for our final response to this request by 20
working days, i.e., until 10 October 2023. Section 10 of the Act allows
such an extension where an exemption is engaged, in this case Section 42
relating to legal professional privilege, which requires the application
of the public interest test, for which the extension may be taken.
We will advise you of your rights to complain and to contact the
Information Commissioner with our final response.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [2][Sheffield City Council request email]
show quoted sections

Dear FOI,
Thank you for your partial response to my FOI request. Unfortunately, you have referred me to supposedly 'relevant' files from the Street Tree Archive which are all restricted so they can’t be accessed and one is non-existent. This is clearly of no use to my enquiry and a waste of my time entering each case number.
My request is quite straightforward but I think I could have worded it better to focus your response. I would like to rephrase my question which I hope will get us to a satisfactory response more quickly:
In 2017, Sheffield City Council issued requests to a number of people to sign 'undertakings' regarding their protest behaviour against the unnecessary felling of street trees. Requests were issued at different times, eg.; by letters dated 27.06.17 and 29.06.17, both Ref. GEG/079474. Undertakings were signed at different times; some before the first deadline of 11.07.17, some before an extended deadline of 20.07.17 granted by SCC via Howells Solicitors, one or more signed just before the first hearing of case D92LS739 at Leeds High Court on 26.07.17. There are possibly other dates in 2017 when undertaking requests were issued and signed. I would like to know if and how the text of the request documentation and undertaking forms to be signed were different. In short, did the conditions for ‘undertakers’ vary?
Yours sincerely,
Martin Pickles

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please pass this on to the person who conducts Freedom of Information reviews.
I am writing to request an internal review of Sheffield City Council's handling of my FOI request 'Request for documents issued for undertakings signed on 26.07.17 with regard to Leeds High Court case for application of an injunction: SCC vs Alice Fairhall et al (Case D92LS739)'.
Over two months have passed since I submitted my FOI request and I still haven't received anything approaching an adequate or appropriate response. Please could this be attended to.  If the Legal & Governance Dept can provide the information with the same urgency they issued the original paperwork, we should have this wrapped up pretty quickly.
A full history of my FOI request and all correspondence is available on the Internet at this address:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/r...
Yours faithfully,
Martin Pickles

Dear Martin Pickles,
Thank you for your recent request for an internal review relating to
documents issued for undertakings signed on 26.07.17 with regard to Leeds
High Court case for application of an injunction: SCC vs Alice Fairhall et
al (Case D92LS739) which we received on 18/10/2023.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team.
The Freedom of Information Code of Practice states that we should aim to
your request for internal review within 20 working days, by 15/11/2023.
Please do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you
have any queries.
Please note that the Code of Practice does allow us to extend this
deadline by an additional 20 days in some situations. If we need more time
to complete the internal review, we will contact you to inform you of
this.
If you have any queries in the meantime, please contact us at the email
address below.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please pass this on to the person who conducts Freedom of Information reviews.
I am writing to request an internal review of Sheffield City Council's handling of my FOI request 'Request for documents issued for undertakings signed on 26.07.17 with regard to Leeds High Court case for application of an injunction: SCC vs Alice Fairhall et al (Case D92LS739)'.
Six months on from my request, I haven't received a satisfactory reply from Sheffield City Council (SCC) or even any correspondence to say they are working on it.  I currently have another ongoing outstanding serious formal complaint with SCC which they have failed to deal with since it was lodged nearly three years ago.
A full history of my FOI request and all correspondence is available on the Internet at this address:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/r...
Yours faithfully,
Martin Pickles
